018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import org.opengis.feature.Feature;
022import org.opengis.geometry.Envelope;
023import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
024
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
026import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
027
028
029/**
030 * Operator that tests whether two expressions that evaluate to geometric values satisfy
031 * the spatial relationship implied by the operator.
032 * The nature of the comparison is dependent on the {@linkplain #getOperatorType() operator type}.
033 * A standard set of spatial operators is equal, disjoin, touches, within, overlaps, crosses,
034 * intersects, contains, beyond and BBOX.
035 *
036 * <div class="note"><b>Example:</b>
037 * An operator of type {@link SpatialOperatorName#OVERLAPS} evaluates whether the geometric value
038 * of the first expression and the geometric value of the second expression spatially overlap.</div>
039 *
040 * @author  Chris Dillard (SYS Technologies)
041 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
042 * @version 3.1
043 * @since   3.1
044 *
045 * @param  <R>  the type of resources (e.g. {@link org.opengis.feature.Feature}) to filter.
046 */
047@UML(identifier="BinarySpatialOperator", specification=ISO_19143)
048public interface BinarySpatialOperator<R> extends SpatialOperator<R> {
049    /**
050     * Returns the nature of the operator. A standard set of spatial operators is equal,
051     * disjoin, touches, within, overlaps, crosses, intersects, contains, beyond and BBOX.
052     *
053     * @return the nature of the operator.
054     */
055    @Override
056    @UML(identifier="operatorType", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
057    SpatialOperatorName getOperatorType();
058
059    /**
060     * Returns the first expression to be evaluated.
061     * This is the element at index 0 in the {@linkplain #getExpressions() expressions} list.
062     * The returned expression <em>should</em> be an instance of {@link ValueReference}.
063     * The {@linkplain Expression#apply expression evaluation} should return one of the following type:
064     *
065     * <ul>
066     *   <li>A geometry instance.</li>
067     *   <li>A {@link Feature} instance if the operator shall be applied to the geometric values
068     *       of all the spatial properties of the resource.</li>
069     * </ul>
070     *
071     * This {code BinarySpatialOperator} evaluates to {@code true} if all tested spatial property values
072     * fulfill the spatial relationship implied by the operator.
073     *
074     * @return the first expression to be evaluated.
075     *
076     * @departure generalization
077     *   ISO 19143 restricts the type to {@link ValueReference}.
078     *   GeoAPI relaxes this restriction by allowing arbitrary expressions.
079     */
080    @UML(identifier="operand1", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
081    default Expression<R,?> getOperand1() {
082        return getExpressions().get(0);
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Returns the second expression to be evaluated.
087     * This is the element at index 1 in the {@linkplain #getExpressions() expressions} list.
088     * The returned expression should one of the following:
089     *
090     * <ul>
091     *   <li>A {@link ValueReference}.</li>
092     *   <li>A {@link Literal} evaluating to a geometry object.</li>
093     *   <li>A {@link Literal} evaluating to an {@link Envelope}.</li>
094     * </ul>
095     *
096     * @return the second expression to be evaluated.
097     *
098     * @departure constraint
099     *   ISO 19143 restricts the type to {@code SpatialDescription}, which is a union between
100     *   {@code Geometry}, {@code Envelope} and {@code ValueReference}.
101     *   Union has no direct equivalence in Java and is replaced by documentation in this method.
102     */
103    @UML(identifier="operand2", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
104    default Expression<R,?> getOperand2() {
105        return getExpressions().get(1);
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Returns the two expressions to be evaluated by this operator.
110     * The list shall contain {@linkplain #getOperand1() operand 1}
111     * and {@linkplain #getOperand2() operand 2} in that order.
112     *
113     * @return a list of size 2 containing the two expressions to be evaluated.
114     */
115    @Override
116    List<Expression<R,?>> getExpressions();
117}
